result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie L. McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,502.38 to Accoustech Supply; $348.00 to Cabinet to Go; $3,204.75 to Carpet Town; $1,063.40 to Cash and Carry; $6,284.91 to Ferguson; $1,054.95 to Hot Water Products; $4,745.69 to Lumber Liquidators and $525.71 to Safe Lite.

AS TO THIS CASE:  Provide DNA sample if one has not been provided, pay appropriate costs on each count.  Pay all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments. 
02-18-2016/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
AS TO THIS CASE, ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATION/RESTITUTION:  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended supervison.  To convert to a civil judgment that is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNT ONE, TWO AND THREE:  Consecutive to one another, consecutive to 13CF3157 and 14CF622 and consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Partially Granting Motion for Postconviction Relief, signed and filed.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED the defendant's motion for postconviction relief is granted in part; the DNA surcharges on counts one and two in 13CF3157 and on count three in 14CF622 are VACATED.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to vacate the DNA surcharges in 14CF383 and count nine in 14CF622 is denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to order the DOC to change the defendant's prison funds withholding percentage is denied.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's Motion for Post Conviction Relief dated February 15, 2016. tf

per remittitur dated January 26, 2016 IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report in appeal Nos. 2015AP619-CRNM, 2015AP620-CRNM, and 2015AP621-CRNM is rejected and the appeals are dismissed without prejudice.
 IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in these matters is extended to February 15, 2016.  tf

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sallie M.
The Court imposes the following  Sentence:  As to Count 1:  Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 2 years.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 year.  Defendant shall serve 1 year on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  As to Count 2:  Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 2 years.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 year.  Defendant shall serve 1 year on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  As to Count 3:  Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 2 years.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 year.  Defendant shall serve 1 year on EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 
Counts 1, 2 & 3 to run consecutive to one another.  Sentences are consecutive to 13CF3157 and 14CF622 and consecutive to any other sentence.  There is 83 days credit for time served.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R3.
Conditions of Extended Supervision are:
- no controlled substance or alcohol
- AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens
- no contact with Larry B, Darnell L, any of the victims (suppliers), Jeremy B and Michael S
- seek and maintain employment
- vocational training
- parenting classes
- cognitive thinking counseling
- defendant shall provide a DNA sample, if one has not been provided and pay all appropriate costs on each count
- Court ordered restitution in the total amount of $173,124.74 on this case and cases 13CF3157, 14CF622 and dismissed and read in cases from Racine and Waukesha counties. Restitution on this case paid at $2,502.38 to Acoustech Supply, $348.09 to Cabinet to Go, $3,204.75 to Carpet Town,$1,063.40 to Cash and Carry, $6,284.91 to Ferguson, $1,054.95 to Hot Water Products, $4,745.69 to Lumber Liquidators and $525.71 to Safe Lite.  Defendant to pay restitution on cases 13CF3157 and 14CF622.  Defendant to pay restitution in the amounts of $1,434.83 to Mileagers, $4,733.44 to Drexel, $3,234.82 to First Supply, $2,867.47 to Carpet City and $977.43 to Sterling Mainz Plumbing.  Restitution to be paid first.
The Court ordered that restitution and all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargble in bankruptcy.  Defendant is REMANDED.  
Filed with the Court:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form and Written Explanation of Deteminate Sentence.

/(2) and Restitution Worksheet, filed. rn
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed. rn
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The State advised the Court that per negotiations, the State would not charge but read in 15 additional checks.  Plea hearing proceeds.  

AS TO COUNTS #1 - #3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties requested an adjournment for the sentencing hearing to attempt to consolidate cases from other counties into this case.  Court granted joint request and continued  sentencing before Branch 20 on April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request that case accompany lower-pending case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (ABSOLUTELY NO RELEASE FROM HOME (24 HOUR CURFEW))with DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
